definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: You associate each part of what you have to remember with a landmark in a route you know well, like your commute to work.
sentences.chinese: 把你熟记的路线都联系起来，你比如乘车上班。

sentences.english: You should memorize the key points of each lesson.
sentences.chinese: 你应该熟记每一节课的重点。

sentences.english: Real grammarians, by the way, have memorized the AP Stylebook.
sentences.chinese: 顺便说下，真正的语法学家已经将所有样本熟记于心。

sentences.english: However hard I tried, I could not memorize the text.
sentences.chinese: 不管我尽了多大努力，我也不能熟记课文。

sentences.english: Dean memorized exactly where everything was so he could find it later.
sentences.chinese: 狄恩熟记每件东西确切位置，以便以后可以找得到。

sentences.english: He can memorize this passage in ten minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他十分钟就能熟记这篇文章。

sentences.english: Why is verse 28 such a good verse to remember, or even to memorize?
sentences.chinese: 为什么28节是金句，甚至是应当熟记的经文？

sentences.english: You should memorize the alphabet at first.

definition: lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
to learn by heart/to commit to memory/to remember/to memorize in silence
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
to make a deeper impression on sb
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
